lines.text: Ma'am, did he hear that or did he smell it?
That's Mr. Charles, isn't it?
Yes'm.
This is a cocktail, isn't it?
Yes'm.
They'll get together.
He's getting more like his father everyday.
He sure is. This morning he was playing with a corkscrew.
Nicky, something tells me that something important is happening somewhere and I think we should be there.
[cut to Nora with a cocktail shaker]
Follow that car, quick!
Yes, ma'am!
[Drives off after cab, leaving Nora and Molly on the sidewalk]
And I haven't killed a jockey in weeks - really.
You know that jockey Golez, the one who was caught throwing the fourth race yesterday? He was shot.
My, they're strict at this track!
Hiya Nick.
Hiya Spider.
Where ya' been? How come I ain't seen ya' around?
I've been around. Where you been?
I ain't been around.
No? In stir?
I was the victim of circumstances. The D.A. framed me, not knowin' I was guilty. Ain't that a coincidence?
Yeah. Spider, I want you to meet Mrs. Charles. Dear, this is Spider Webb.
You're Nick's wife?
Yeah. Ain't that a coincidence?
Well, gentlemen and ladies we have our murderer.
Nicky, I can't stand it! Was it me?
Mommy, he's a great kid. I'm much obliged.
Oh, it was nothing. Any time.
Well, doc?
Shot.
No kidding. I thought maybe he drowned.
With the $2 dinner, you get machine guns.
You're gonna see some great wrestling tonight.
How do you know? You were at the rehearsal?
[to the dog]
Asta, you keep Mommy quiet.

[Reading the "laundry list" found in Whitey Barrow's pocket]
Three bloomers, twenty-five kimonos, ten slips, five panties, fifteen chemises.
Sounds like wash day at Vassar.
